distantia 2.0.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Reference

Naming Conventions

The package follows these naming conventions:

  • tsl_...(): functions to generate, process, and explore time series lists (TSLs).
  • zoo_...(): functions to work with zoo time series.
  • distantia_...(): functions to compare time series via dynamic time warping or lock-step methods.
  • psi_...(): step-by-step demonstration of how psi dissimilarity scores are computed.
  • utils_...(): internal functions and helpers.
  • f_...(): transformation functions used as input arguments for other functions.
  • ..._cpp(): C++ functions built via Rcpp for efficient dissimilarity analysis.

Example Data

Time series datasets from different disciplines and functions to simulate time series data, to help learning how to use the R package distantia.

albatross

Flight Paths of Albatrosses

cities_coordinates

Coordinates of 100 Major Cities

cities_temperature

Long Term Monthly Temperature in 100 Major Cities

covid_coordinates

Coordinates of the Covid Dataset.

covid_prevalence

Covid19 dataset.

eemian_coordinates

Coordinates of Nine Eemian Sites

eemian_pollen

Pollen Counts of Nine Eemian Sites in Central Europe

fagus_coordinates

Coordinates of Fagus sylvatica stands

fagus_dynamics

Enhanced Vegetation Index and Climate of Three Fagus sylvatica stands

mis

Interglacial Pollen Counts

tsl_simulate()

Simulated Time Series List

zoo_simulate()

Simulate Zoo Time Series

Dissimilarity Analysis and Clustering

Functions to compare time series either via dynamic time warping or lock-step comparison, understand the partial contribution of individual variables to dissimilarity, and cluster time series based on dissimilarity scores.

distantia()

Time Series Dissimilarity Analysis

distantia_aggregate()

Aggregates a Distantia Data Frame

distantia_boxplot()

Dissimilarity Boxplots

Contribution of Individual Variables to Dissimilarity

distantia_matrix()
